stages.title: Time to Sleep
stages.text: With the moon hanging high in the sky, the time to sleep has once again come. If you wish, you may continue to travel through the night, but without ample light, the road may be difficult to follow and <color=#00FFFF>without sleep, you will surely be exhausted come morning.</color>

stages.title: Time to Sleep
stages.text:
You set up a small camp off the side of the road and drift off to sleep. When you awaken in the morning, you feel well-rested and eat a meal before continuing down the road.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Food.</color>

stages.title: Time to Sleep
stages.text:
You set up a small camp off the side of the road and drift off to sleep. When you awaken in the morning, you feel well-rested, but without any food, you must continuing down the road with an empty stomach.

<color=#FF0000>You grow hungry.</color>

stages.title: Time to Sleep
stages.text: There is no time for sleep. After a brief rest, you continue down the road.

stages.title: Morning Meal
stages.text:
As the sun rises, your stomach grumbles. You take a seat off the road and have your morning meal.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Food.
You feel exhausted.</color>

stages.title: Morning Meal
stages.text:
As the sun rises your stomach grumbles. You have exhausted your supply of food, and must go hungry.

<color=#FF0000>You grow hungry.
You feel exhausted.</color>

stages.title: Midday Meal
stages.text:
As the sun hangs high in the sky, you decide to break for a quick meal.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 food.</color>

stages.title: Midday Meal
stages.text:
As the sun hangs high in the sky, you feel your stomach grumble. Without food, there is nothing to eat, so you continue along the road.

<color=#FF0000>You grow hungry.</color>

stages.title: Evening Meal
stages.text:
As the sun sets, you decide to enjoy an evening meal.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 food.</color>

stages.title: Evening Meal
stages.text:
As the sun sets, you feel your stomach growl. Without food, you must continue without a meal.

<color=#FF0000>You grow hungry.</color>

stages.title: Mystery Berries
stages.text:
You find a bush of berries as you are walking along the trail. You decide to stop and gather some berries to eat later on your journey.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 4 Food</color>

stages.title: People Approaching
stages.text: As you walk down the road, you notice a group of people approaching.

stages.title: People Approaching
stages.text: You duck into the bushes and wait until they pass. Once you are sure the coast is clear, you get up and continue on your way.

stages.title: People Approaching
stages.text:
As you start running, you hear the group shouting as they come after you. You duck into the woods and hide among the bushes until they give up looking, but in your flight you sprained your ankle.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Health</color>

stages.title: Pharmacy Stop
stages.text: On the corner of the town square there sits a small shop with a wooden mortar and pestle hanging above the door. Inside, the tall oaken shelves bow with rows and rows of <color=#00FFFF>bottles, strange tinctures, and unlabeled barrels.</color> The man at the counter straightens and glowers at you from under heavy brows and a heavier mustache.

stages.title: Pharmacy Stop
stages.text: You locate a small bottle of pills with the image of a bandaged wound on the side. You take them to the counter and learn the price is 25 cents.

stages.title: Pharmacy Stop
stages.text:
You wander blindly around the shop, unfamiliar words looming up around you. Fluid extract of baptista. Chlorodine. Creosote. Permanganate of Potash.

 The owner's glowering eyes follow you suspiciously until he stands up with his fists on his hips. "I think that's enough browsing, stranger. <color=#00FFFF>Leave this shop now."</color> There's a current of threat to his voice.

It's dangerous to argue. You shuffle away from the pharmacy empty-handed.

stages.title: Pharmacy Stop
stages.text:
You pay for the medicine and head on your way.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 2 Health</color>
 <color=#00FF00>Lose 25 Cents</color>

stages.title: Pharmacy Stop
stages.text: Upon hearing the price, you glance at your empty purse, the sad few coins rattling against each other: <color=#00FFFF>not nearly enough money</color>. You put the bottle on the counter and mumble something about going to grab more money, then hastily back out of the shop empty-handed.

stages.title: Pharmacy Stop
stages.text: The jingle of coins in your purse softens the man at the counter to your cause. He points you to <color=#00FFFF>a small bottle of pills</color> with the image of a bandaged wound on the side.

stages.title: Pharmacy Stop
stages.text:
His eyes narrow as you approach. "Say, what's a dark one like you doing up here, anyway?"

 You stammer something about a trip to assist your master, but the shopkeep seems unconvinced. He leans forward on his elbows to peer at you close across the counter.

"Lotta runaways pass through this town. There's a bulletin full of 'em. And lots of rewards besides. Call themselves 'freedom seekers.'" He scoffs. "You wouldn't know anything about that, would you?"

 You don't like the way he's looking at you. Mumbling something about being behind schedule, <color=#00FFFF>you back out of the shop.</color>

stages.title: Mystery Mushrooms
stages.text: Off the side of the road is a <color=#00FFFF>cluster of mushrooms</color> growing on a rotten log.

stages.title: Mystery Mushrooms
stages.text: Upon closer examination, you see the mushrooms have slender white stems and pale, round caps. You recognize these as <color=#00FFFF>poisonous</color>, causing stomach upset. You leave them be.

stages.title: Mystery Mushrooms
stages.text: Upon closer examination, you see the mushrooms have slender white stems and pale, round caps. <color=#00FFFF>You don't recognize them.</color> What if they're poisonous?

stages.title: Mystery Mushrooms
stages.text:
You pluck a few and try one as you continue walking. It doesn't take long before <color=#00FFFF>your stomach begins to churn,</color> and you barely make it to the edge of the road before <color=#00FFFF>you vomit.</color> 
<color=#00FF00>Lose 1 Health</color>

stages.title: Toll Bridge
stages.text:
Ahead, you see a thick band of water twisting through the woods. <color=#00FFFF>The road comes to a bridge,</color> where a bored-looking man in a uniform dozes against a piling. He shakes himself and stands as you approach. 

<color=#00FFFF>"Toll is 25 cents,"</color> He says, holding out a hand expectantly. "I'm sure your master gave you some coin for it."

stages.title: Toll Bridge
stages.text: You hand over the money and continue on your way.

stages.title: Toll Bridge
stages.text:
You check your purse. <color=#00FFFF>25 cents is more money than you have.</color> "My - my master must have forgotten," you lie.

The man shrugs. "No toll, no bridge." He cracks a crooked grin. "But the river is free."

stages.title: Toll Bridge
stages.text:
You can hear the guard cackling as you make your way down to the water. He leers at you from over the side of the bridge. It's icy cold, but shallower than you'd thought. You wade across the river.

The rushing water beats against you, but you keep your balance and <color=#00FFFF>you emerge on the other side, wet but safe.</color>

You turn to see the bridge guard on the other side applauding. "Didn't think you had it in you," the guard says. "I'll tell your master when he comes along that he sure bought a strong one."

You hurry away from the bridge before he can talk about your made-up master any longer.

stages.title: Toll Bridge
stages.text:
You can hear the guard cackling as you make your way down to the water. You dip a foot in; it's icy cold. 
The current pummels you from the side with icy fists. The gravel beneath your foot gives way and you splash down into the freezing water. You get a desperate gasp of air before you're dragged under, kicking and flailing.
Luckily, the river spits you out rather than pulling you to a watery death. <color=#00FFFF>You wash up a half-mile away from the road,</color> bruised from where the river threw you against the rocky shore.
You're across the river now, at least.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Health</color>

stages.title: Wild Carrots
stages.text:
In the dappled shadows of a nearby grove, you spot a delicate cluster of white blooms nodding in the gentle breeze. Queen Anne's Lace: <color=#00FFFF>wild carrots.</color> You gather some for the road.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 4 Food</color>

stages.title: Briar Patch
stages.text: Before you, the road takes a broad curve around a massive briar patch. You pause in front of it; the foliage is dense and bristling with thorns, though you can make out some blackberries in the thick of it. Squinting, you can tell that the road continues on the other side. <color=#00FFFF>Cutting through the patch would probably be faster, but it might hurt.</color>

stages.title: Briar Patch
stages.text: You take the long way around to avoid the jabbing thorns.

stages.title: Briar Patch
stages.text:
You plunge boldly into the thicket. Thorns rake your arms and chew at your clothes. Kicking and shoving and thoroughly irritated, you push through the center of the patch.

The blackberries are ripe and plump, sheltered by the thorns from hungry animals, but not safe from you. After <color=#00FFFF>stuffing the berries into your pack,,/color> you fight your way through to the other side of the patch. Your skin burns where the thorns raked it, but <color=#00FFFF>you make it back out onto the road</color> in mostly one piece. 

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Health</color> 

<color=#00FF00>Gain 3 Food</color>

stages.title: Broken Wagon
stages.text:
The winding path exits the woods to cross a swath of farmland. Small white houses dot the fields, surrounded by grazing animals and seas of corn. Here and there you can see people tilling the soil or driving cows. A dog barks, sending a drop of cold sweat down your spine - but it doesn't sound like a tracker hound. You come across two men arguing beside <color=#00FFFF>a wagon with a fallen wheel.</color>

"If we can get the wheel back on, we can still make it to town," says the younger. 

The elder spots you and waves. "Hey, you there! <color=#00FFFF>How about a quick coin?"</color>

stages.title: Broken Wagon
stages.text:
"Oh, no, I'm in a hurry," you mumble. "So sorry."

The two stare at you in surprise as <color=#00FFFF>you rush down the road past them.</color> You turn your face so that they hopefully can't see it if the slave-catchers come asking.

"Whoever's the master got a damn bad deal for that one,' the older man mutters behind you.

"Language," his brother says.

stages.title: Broken Wagon
stages.text:
The two of you lift the wagon in tandem, one brother tries to shove the wheel into place with grunt. After a few attempts, <color=#00FFFF>the wheel slides onto its axle again.</color> You set the bulk of it back down, and the younger man pushes the wheel experimentally. It holds.
The older man claps his hands together as if to get dust off. "That'll do it," he says with satisfaction. He <color=#00FFFF>digs out a few coins from a bag in the wagon and passes them to you.</color> "Your master's a lucky one, with a helper like you."

Taking the money, you force a "thank you" and a smile that turns to a grimace as soon as the two are behind you.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 75 Cents</color>

stages.title: Broken Wagon
stages.text: The two of you lift the wagon in tandem, but <color=#00FFFF>your arms falter.</color> Finally the older man waves you away in disgust. "Useless," he grumbles. "Get outta here." You gather up your things and <color=#00FFFF>hurry onward</color>. As you leave, he mutters,"Whoever's the master got a damn bad deal for that one."

stages.title: Fallen Trees
stages.text:
As you near a bend in the path, you hear loud voices beyond. You see a man and a woman arguing tersely beside a large carriage hitched to several horses. <color=#00FFFF>The road beyond is blocked by a massive fallen tree.</color> 
"How was I to know the storm would cause such blockage?" The man grumbles. He sighs and sits heavily on the trunk. He slaps the side of the tree. "If I had a third pair of hands, we might budge this fella. But with just us two, it's not going anywhere."
The woman sits down next to him. <color=#00FFFF>"I'd give good silver for a helping hand right now."</color>

choices.buttonText: Cut through the forest to avoid them

stages.title: Fallen Trees
stages.text:
You approach the couple, who turn to you in surprise. "Well, hello," the man says, peering at you in confusion. 
The woman stands. "Oh, thank the Lord. I thought we'd be stuck out here." She looks you up and down. "You look like a strong young traveler. Could you, perhapsâ€¦?" She gestures at the log. <color=#00FFFF>"We can pay."</color>

stages.title: Fallen Trees
stages.text: The duo's voices fade behind you as you climb nimbly over logs and duck bushes. <color=#00FFFF>You come out on the far side of the fallen tree,</color> well down the road and out of sight.

stages.title: Fallen Trees
stages.text:
The duo's voices fade behind you as you climb nimbly over logs and duck bushes. Just as you reach the road again, however, a thorn catches your pant leg. Trying to shake it free, you stumble and land funny on your ankle. A twinge of pain shoots up your leg.

<color=#00FF00>Lose 2 Health</color>

stages.title: Fallen Trees
stages.text:
The three of you grunt and strain and eventually <color=#00FFFF>you manage to heave the log to the side</color> enough to allow the carriage to pass. Fanning herself, the woman thanks you profusely, and the man doffs his cap. <color=#00FFFF>They give you a few coins for your trouble</color> before trundling off down the road ahead of you in their carriage.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 50 Cents</color>

stages.title: Fallen Trees
stages.text: The three of you grunt and strain, but <color=#00FFFF>the log won't budge.</color> The man thanks you for your time, but you can tell his annoyance has grown. You hastily apologize to the travelers and <color=#00FFFF>continue on your way</color> at a faster pace, glancing over your shoulder, but they can't follow.

stages.title: The Hounds Attack
stages.text: You're deep in the forest when you hear a harsh baying that rattles your bones like thunderclaps. Before you know it, before you even have time to turn and run, <color=#00FFFF>the slave catchers' dogs are upon you.</color> Their teeth flash in the dull sunlight as they snap and charge at your legs. <color=#00FFFF>Fangs sink into your calf</color> and you stifle a cry of pain: noise will only bring their masters closer.

stages.title: The Hounds Attack
stages.text:
Your feet pound against the forest floor, and you fly like a crazed deer through the woods, leaping logs and ducking branches. The hounds and the shouts of their masters fade, but baying echoes in your ears even as <color=#00FFFF>the dogs and the slave-catchers vanish behind you.</color>

Eventually you slow, panting, and dare a glance behind you. No sign of pursuit, but you're certain they won't be far behind. Quickening your step, <color=#00FFFF>you continue on your way.</color>

stages.title: The Hounds Attack
stages.text:
You scramble ahead, but <color=#00FFFF>the hounds are faster.</color> A fang seizes your leg, then another, and you crash to the ground in a flurry of savage snarls. 
You manage to kick the hounds away and scramble to your feet. You haul yourself into the reeds of a nearby creek, where your scent will be lost in the muck. The grimy water washes blood downstream in a red trickle.

The dogs sniff around the river's edge. Their master hollers to them over the hill. At his call, <color=#00FFFF>they give up and vanish into the forest again.</color> You limp, bloody and rank, from the swamp.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 4 Health.</color>

stages.title: The Hounds Attack
stages.text:
You kick and stomp, beating off the hounds with your hands until the savage snarls turn to yelps and whimpers, and you manage to stumble away through the woods. Fingers slipping on the ragged bark, you drag yourself into the branches of a tree. 
The catchers stalk into sight below you, grumbling to their whining animals and gripping their guns. Rifle steel glints in the dull light. They could look up, any moment...
But the hounds, dazed, have lost your scent, and soon both the dogs and their masters have moved deeper into the woods and out of sight.

stages.title: The Hounds Attack
stages.text:
You swing and stomp, but <color=#00FFFF>there are too many hounds.</color> One seizes your leg, then another, and you crash to the ground in a flurry of savage snarls.
You manage to kick the hounds away and scramble to your feet. You haul yourself into the reeds of a nearby creek. Tour scent will be lost in the muck. The grimy water washes blood downstream in a red trickle.

The dogs sniff around the river's edge. Their master hollers to them over the hill. At his call, <color=#00FFFF>they give up and vanish into the forest.</color> You limp, bloody and rank, from the swamp. 

<color=#FF0000>Lose 4 Health.</color>

stages.title: Thunderstorm
stages.text: Throughout the day you've watched low, dark clouds piling up on the horizon with growing unease. <color=#00FFFF>The sky breaks open with rain as the road winds out of the forest.</color> Torrents of rain flush through the trees and soak quickly into your clothes. A tongue of lightning licks a far-off cornfield, and thunder moans in the distance.

stages.title: Thunderstorm
stages.text:
At the edge of the woods, you spot a small, crooked shed that looks abandoned. You duck inside to <color=#00FFFF>wait out the storm.</color> Leaks trickle through the gaps between boards in the ceiling, but compared to outside, the shelter is practically bone-dry.

It takes the storm an hour to pass, and then you can continue on your way.

stages.title: Thunderstorm
stages.text:
You try to pull your shirt over your head to keep out the rain as you walk out of the woods, but it just soaks through. Soon you're as wet as if you climbed out of a river and just as shivery. Lightning flashes periodically, followed by great rumbles of thunder that roll back and forth across the sky. But <color=#00FFFF>you're able to keep moving,</color> and the storm passes in an hour.

<color=#00FF00>Lose 1 Health</color>

stages.title: Stonemason
stages.text:
The trail brings you through a smattering of tiny houses built on small plots of land. The buildings look hand-hewn, ramshackle, but there's also something intimate about them that the huge farmhouses down South don't have.
One plot holds only half a house. Its owner, you presume, is the old Black woman fanning herself in the shade of a half-built awning. <color=#00FFFF>The old woman waves lazily, beckoning you.</color> 'Where you going in such a rush, young 'un?'

stages.title: Stonemason
stages.text:
You stop and wave back. 'Howdy, missus. Just - seeing sights, up here in Ohio.'

'Not normally from around these parts, eh?'

'Just passing through.'

She cackles in a way that makes you think she caught the hidden meaning. 'Well, youngster, you look the sturdy sort. If you <color=#00FFFF>help me lay bricks for a few hours,</color> I reckon I can spare <color=#00FFFF>some food and change</color> for this tour of yours.' She gestures for you to come over.

stages.title: Stonemason
stages.text:
You wave back, but time is precious. 'Sorry, missus. Got a schedule to keep.' You hustle on, though you feel her disappointed eyes on your back.

'Good luck, youngster,' she calls after you.

stages.title: Stonemason
stages.text:
The two of you get to mixing mortar, measuring guideposts, and slapping bricks down. The old lady, you learn, was once from Georgia, and the withered scars on her muscled arms show she didn't live there free.

When the wall is leveled out, she stands back. 'I think I've worked you hard enough, young 'un,' she says. 'Can't pause your tour too long.' 

The sun has shifted in the sky. You nod.

She grabs <color=#00FFFF>a bag of food and a few coins</color> from her cellar. 'Good luck,' she says.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 6 Food</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain +1 Strength</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain 1 Dollar</color>

stages.title: Stonemason
stages.text:
You struggle to carry the bricks. Trekking through the forest has fatigued you. You've barely carried three loads before you have to stop and rest.
The woman notices. 'Heavens, love,' she says. 'If this little trifle has gotten you winded, you have a long, long walk ahead.'

You hate to admit it, but she's correct. And <color=#00FFFF>based on the position of the sun, you've already lost an hour.</color>

'Well, I ain't got much. But here's a little good eating.' She hands you <color=#00FFFF>a small bag of food,</color> looking suddenly somber. 'Good luck, youngster.'

<color=#00FF00>Gain 2 Food</color>

stages.title: Deer Trail
stages.text:
As the terrain becomes hillier, the trail takes switchbacks back and forth across the slopes. The zigzagging route makes frustratingly slow forward progress. 
However, at the beginning of one of the switchbacks, you notice that <color=#00FFFF>a small trail leads off into the woods and then sharply downhill.</color> Narrow and a bit hard to see, you can tell that this is probably a path carved by deer making their way through the woods. <color=#00FFFF>It could get you past the switchbacks faster - if you don't lose the trail.</color>

stages.title: Deer Trail
stages.text: You push through the brush, following the overgrown path and trying to keep your eyes on the delicate hoof tracks. The deer trail veers sharply towards a steep, rocky hillside down which you carefully climb, dislodging a few pebbles as you go. At the bottom, the ground flattens out again, and <color=#00FFFF>you can see the proper road through the foliage.</color> You push through the bushes and continue along it, having passed the switchbacks.

stages.title: Deer Trail
stages.text: You push through the brush, following the overgrown path and trying to keep your eyes on the delicate hoof tracks. Soon, however, <color=#00FFFF>you lose track of the trail</color> through the hanging moss and dense thickets of foliage and find yourself lost in the woods. Only after a frustrating hour of wandering do you stumble back onto the road.

stages.title: Deer Trail
stages.text: Biting back your frustration, <color=#00FFFF>you continue along the switchbacks.</color/> It's not worth the risk to save a few extra minutes.

stages.title: Bloodroot
stages.text: Growing on the roadside is a patch of white flowers with long petals whose leaves remind you of oak. You recognize these as bloodroot. Faintly, you can remember that <color=#00FFFF>this plant can be used as medicine - if you can recall how to prepare it.</color>

stages.title: Bloodroot
stages.text:
As you pull up the roots, the familiarity of the motion brings the memories back to you. Drying and then grinding the root makes a paste that can prevent wounds from infection. <color=#00FFFF>A very useful medicine.</color> You harvest several of the plants and put them in your bag to dry as you walk.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 2 Medicine</color>

stages.title: Bloodroot
stages.text: You poke at the roots and pull a few up, but <color=#00FFFF>nothing comes to mind,</color> and you're not sure what would happen if you prepared it wrong. Some plants are poisonous without proper prep. You decide it's best to not risk it.

stages.title: Abandoned Cart
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>An empty horsecart</color> sits in the ditch at the side of the road in front of a long driveway. Nobody seems to be tending the cart, especially if they're busy at the other end of the driveway. It seems that nobody is around to see you <color=#00FFFF>if you look inside.</color>

stages.title: Abandoned Cart
stages.text:
The inside of the cart is surprisingly plush, with pillows on the seats and everything. In the back is what seems to be a picnic basket covered in an embroidered cloth. As you lift the cloth, <color=#00FFFF>the smell of fresh cheese and warm bread</color> makes your mouth water. <color=#00FFFF>You snatch the basket and run.</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain 2 Food</color>

stages.title: Abandoned Cart
stages.text: The inside of the cart is surprisingly plush, with pillows on the seats and everything. In the back is what seems to be a picnic basket covered in an embroidered cloth. As you lift the cloth, <color=#00FFFF>the smell of fresh cheese and warm bread</color> makes your mouth water. But as you lift the basket from the seat, <color=#00FFFF>you hear an angry shout.</color> Your eyes fly to a figure at the curve in the driveway. 'THIEF!' He yells.

stages.title: Abandoned Cart
stages.text:
The click of a rifle cocking rings out, then a shot that shatters the bark of a nearby tree. <color=#00FFFF>You drop the basket and dash away down the road,</color> hoping they won't pursue. "Dammit, get my horse, get my horse!" the person behind you roars. 
As you round the corner, you hear the thunder of hooves behind you and throw yourself into the ditch. Laying in the shade of the shrubs, you watch the horseman speed by. After waiting, listening hard for further sounds of pursuit, <color=#00FFFF>you push yourself up and tiptoe back along the road.</color>

stages.title: Abandoned Cart
stages.text:
Your foot catches on the jagged ground and <color=#00FFFF>you fall over.</color> You throw your hands up in a desperate attempt to sheild yourself. "Please, didn't mean any harm -"
You glimpse old, patched clothes, battered shoes. Dark skin.
"What's that, John?" someone calls from down the path.
John takes you by the elbow and hauls you to your feet.
"Run," he hisses. "Before my master gets here."
The crunch of footsteps descend towards you down the driveway and <color=#00FFFF>you flee.</color>
Only later do you stop and think what John risked for you.

<color=#00FF00>Lose 1 Health.</color>

stages.title: Abandoned Cart
stages.text: The cart looks well-kept. You can make out plush pillows inside. It probably belongs to someone rich, someone white. You can't risk setting someone like that against you. <color=#00FFFF>You hurry on your way.</color>

stages.title: Rattlesnake
stages.text: While attempting a shortcut across a field, you hear a telltale rattling, buzzing noise from the tall grass. You freeze instantly, looking around. There, <color=#00FFFF>a pace from your foot, is the rattlesnake:</color> a coiled bundle of mottled green scales and lean muscle. It hisses at you, its head swaying slightly back and forth. The rattle comes again, louder, as you try to step to the side. You see those muscles bunching together as if <color=#00FFFF>ready to strike.</color>

stages.title: Rattlesnake
stages.text: You leap sideways and the snake strikes beside you. You stumble backwards as it pulls away, tail rattling. For a moment, its beady, blank eyes look into your own. Then the snake vanishes into the grass in a flicker of green, and <color=#00FFFF>you're safe.</color>

stages.title: Rattlesnake
stages.text:
You leap sideways, but the head comes whipping around, and <color=#00FFFF>you feel a sharp, stabbing pain in your ankle.</color> You cry out and try to kick it off, but it's already detached, pulling back into its coils. After an angry hiss, the snake vanishes into the grass in a flicker of green. Your ankle throbs with pain as you hobble through the rest of the field, peering anxiously at every stone and loop of grass before you step.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Health</color>

stages.title: Rattlesnake
stages.text:
You strike out with your heavy, booted foot and hit the snake before it can bite. Its head rolls sideways, and in a frenzy of stomping you leap upon it until the thick green coils still, twitching. You stand back, panting - <color=#00FFFF>the snake is dead,</color> leaking a little blood from a caved-in skull. You've eaten rattlesnake before, when rations shrank. But you never did the killing yourself before. As you pick up the dead snake, you feel equal parts triumphant and nauseated.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 1 Food</color>

stages.title: Rattlesnake
stages.text:
You strike out with your heavy, booted foot and hit the snake before it can bite, but the head comes whipping around, and <color=#00FFFF>you feel a sharp, stabbing pain in your ankle.</color> You cry out and try to kick it off, but it's already detached, pulling back into its coils. After an angry hiss, the snake vanishes into the grass in a flicker of green. Your ankle throbs with pain as you hobble through the rest of the field, peering anxiously at every stone and loop of grass before you step.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Health</color>

stages.title: Rattlesnake
stages.text: You and the snake stare each other down for what feels like eternity, its blank, beady eyes fixed on yours, punctuated by the rhythm of its rattle. You quiver slightly, trying your best to not even breathe. The snake should go away if you don't provoke it - please, let it go away. Suddenly, with a final hiss, <color=#00FFFF>the snake vanishes into the grass</color> in a flicker of green. You let out a relieved huff of air and wipe your brow before picking your way through the rest of the field, peering anxiously at every stone and loop of grass before you step.

stages.title: River Crossing
stages.text: You hear the rush water ahead of you and are surprised to find a river through over a gully in the road. Peering down into it, you can see that there used to be a bridge here, based on the rotten pilings sticking out of the water, but it's fallen. <color=#00FFFF>A makeshift road leads sideways along the river,</color> probably to another bridge further down. If you followed, you'd have to walk all the way there and all the way back to the road. On the other hand, the water looks deep and dangerous, but <color=#00FFFF>you might be a strong enough swimmer</color> to make the crossing.

stages.title: River Crossing
stages.text:
The chilly current buffets you from side to side. You throw a leaf in and watch it whirl wildly away downstream. With a deep breath, you plunge in. The water beats against you, sucking at your legs and threatening to yank you under, but you splash through it against the current and towards the opposite shore.

Your feet brush sand again. You gasp with relief and struggle for balance, then slosh your way out of the water and collapse onshore. <color=#00FFFF>You survived,</color> and so did your bag and all of your belongings.

<color=#00FF00>Gain +1 Survival</color>

stages.title: River Crossing
stages.text:
The current pummels you from the side with icy fists. As you near into the raging center, gasping and splashing, an unexpected whirlpool of water sucks onto your legs. You get a desperate gasp of air before you're dragged under, kicking and flailing.

Luckily, the river spits you out rather than pulling you to a watery death. <color=#00FFFF>You wash up a half-mile away from the road,</color> bruised from where the river threw you against the rocky shore. Worse, <color=#00FFFF>your bag popped open in the flood</color> and much of your food and a few bottles of medicine got washed away.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 4 Food</color>
<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Medicine</color>
<color=#FF0000>Lose 3 Health</color>

stages.title: River Crossing
stages.text: The further you walk down the river, the more you're convinced that <color=#00FFFF>the long way is the safe way.</color> Rapids bulge and froth around jagged-looking rocks, and loose wood washes downstream, probably heavy enough to knock out a full-grown man. Still, you're eminently aware of the time passing, and by the time you reach a bridge, you're nearly jogging to get back on the path.

stages.title: Bucking Horse
stages.text: You hear a frenzied nickering and neighing on the path ahead and see a woman on the back of a bucking horse. She spots you and yells for help. 'He's gone mad! Spooked! <color=#00FFFF>Please help me!'</color> She drops the reins and seizes the stomping, angry horse around the neck to keep from falling as her saddle slips and slides.

stages.title: Bucking Horse
stages.text:
You grab the fallen reins that flop like dead snakes on the horse's neck. "Whoa!" You pull on the reins to turn its head, putting a hand on its broad, heavy nose. "Whoa."

The horse shakes its head with a huff of air that blows the scent of stale hay over your face. <color=#00FFFF>But it's stopped bucking.</color> The woman buries her head in the horse's mane, forehead shiny with sweat. 'Thank the Lord,' she sighs, and finally sits up. "He saw a rat or - or some crawling beast and just lost his mind. How can I repay you?"

<color=#00FFFF>"Money never hurts,"</color> you mumble.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 50 Cents.</color>

stages.title: Bucking Horse
stages.text:
You grab the fallen reins that flop like dead snakes on the horse's neck. "Whoa!"

But the horse rears up high on its hind legs, jarring the woman off its back. <color=#00FFFF>She falls with a cry of pain,</color> and it's all you can do to keep the wild horse from trampling her.

It throws the reins off and charges away down the road. "You useless Negro," the woman seethes through gritted teeth. Her face is streaked with blood and dirt.

<color=#00FFFF>You back away and then turn and nearly run down the path</color> before she can grab her riding crop from the ground.

stages.title: Bucking Horse
stages.text:
'Sorry, missus,' you call, dodging around the horse's lethal hooves striking the ground as you dash by. 'I can't!'

The horse rears up high on its hind legs, jarring the woman off its back. She falls hard on the ground with a cry of pain. 'Bastard!' she screams after you, but <color=#00FFFF>you're already out of sight.</color>

stages.title: Rabbit
stages.text: A very brave or very stupid rabbit dashes across the road right in front of you, close enough that it nearly runs over your feet. You glimpse that it's limping slightly. <color=#00FFFF>You might be able to catch it.</color>

stages.title: Rabbit
stages.text:
You run after the rabbit, keeping it locked in your vision even as it zigs and zags across the mulchy forest floor. It struggles for a moment to leap over a low stump and you lunge, <color=#00FFFF>catching it with both bare hands</color>. It's the work of a moment to snap its neck in a twist of your hands. Your stomach growls at the thought of the fresh, warm meat you'll have tonight. And, of course, <color=#00FFFF>rabbit feet are lucky,</color> and you can use all the luck you can get.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 3 Food</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain 1 Luck</color>

stages.title: Rabbit
stages.text: Though it's limping, the rabbit is quick and nimble. You lunge for it with your hands and get a grip on its haunches, but it kicks and then slips through them. You watch with disappointment as <color=#00FFFF>it vanishes into the brush,</color> ignoring your gnawing stomach. Even more to your annoyance, it takes a bit of wandering to find your way back to the road again.

stages.title: Rabbit
stages.text: Rabbits are fast, even lame rabbits. Pursuit would just be a waste of time. You continue down the road.

stages.title: Steamboat Crossing
stages.text: You come to a river wider than one you've yet encountered - wide enough to have a large dock with a steamboat and a group of people waiting to board. When you ask about tickets, the captain tells you that <color=#00FFFF>tickets are 50 cents each.</color>

stages.title: Steamboat Crossing
stages.text:
<color=#00FFFF>You hand over the coins and board the steamboat,</color> trying to angle your face away from the other customers in case they're looking for runaways crossing the river. The river below makes you nervous - you've never ridden a steamboat before. Still, you can't help but feel a thrill of excitement over your nerves as the steamboat chugs off, water rippling smoothly beneath it.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 50 Cents</color>

stages.title: Steamboat Crossing
stages.text:
You stare in dismay at a purse too empty to pay. 'Is - is there another way?'
He spits a wad of tobacco at your feet. <color=#00FFFF>'There's the old rail bridge a few miles thataway.'</color> He jabs a thumb down the river. 
Your stomach sinks. 'No other way to get a ticket, though?'
He squints at you. 'Not for your type. Don't wanna look all suspicious-like if the inspectors come. Though sometimes I make a pretty penny off their visits.'
'I'm sure you do,' you mumble, then hurry downriver to find the bridge.

stages.title: New Clothes
stages.text: Your clothes feel matted and worn and itchy. Your armpits are rank, especially where the fabric has worn through in a hole. The narrow-eyed glances of some passerby are painful reminders that <color=#00FFFF>the rattier you get, the more suspicious you'll look.</color> So when you see a house with a clothesline strung outside and laundry swaying in the breeze, with nobody watching it, <color=#00FFFF>you're tempted to take a more respectable looking outfit for yourself.</color>

stages.title: New Clothes
stages.text:
Someone could be watching from the window, or someone could walk by on the street. Besides, as long as you're clothed with something, surely <color=#00FFFF>you won't draw too much attention.</color>

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Acting</color>

stages.title: Steamboat Crossing
stages.text:
You may look ragged, but you can still run. From the street, you scope out which of the clothes you think might fit. Then <color=#00FFFF>you speed into the yard and yank them off the line.</color> You dash off as quickly as you came. When you're sure the coast is clear and you haven't been followed, <color=#00FFFF>you dip into the woods to change.</color> The new clothes feel expensive and snug compared to your old ones, which you abandon in the gap under a fallen tree trunk. You glance at your reflection in a puddle and smooth a few stray strands of hair into place: much less suspicious.

<color=#00FF00>Gain +1 Acting</color>

stages.title: New Clothes
stages.text:
You've barely approached the clothesline a small girl peeks out at you from behind a tablecloth. She giggles. 'What are you doing?'

'I'm, um. Borrowing some clothes."

She gives you a big-eyed look, then turns towards the house. 'Mama! Someone is borrowing our clothes!'

You <color=#00FFFF>drop the clothes you're holding</color> as a large, aproned woman storms out of the house, rolling pin in one hand. 'Stealing, more like.'

The last thing you want is a fight. Rather than risk her getting within rolling pin distance, <color=#00FFFF>you flee back to the road.</color>

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Acting</color>

stages.title: Robber
stages.text: You don't hear the man until he has a an arm around your neck and something sharp at your back. You can't tell if it's a knife. <color=#00FFFF>'Give me all your money,'</color> a deep voice growls. You smell the stink of meat on his breath and catch a glimpse of stubble over your shoulder.

stages.title: Robber
stages.text:
Your money is precious. You lunge backward, slamming your head into the robber's. Your ears ring and your skull smarts, but the man reels back with a cry, arm loosening. 

You pull yourself free and shove him backwards. He stumbles and trips to the ground. Coins spill from his pockets. You kick him until <color=#00FFFF>he pulls himself to his feet and flees from you.</color>

Adrenaline still pumping in your veins, <color=#00FFFF>you kneel to gather his ill-begotten coins</color> and then move along quickly. You don't want to be here when he finds a real knife to cut you with.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 1 Dollar</color>

stages.title: Robber
stages.text:
You lunge suddenly backward, slamming your head into the robber's. Your ears ring and your skull smarts. The man grunts, but his arm only tightens. A burst of pain shoots down your spine as he presses the sharp object deeper. You can feel a trickle of blood run down your back.

'I said hand it over,' he hisses. 'Or I'll leave this black body of yours for the crows to bury.'

You close your eyes and picture Canada as <color=#00FFFF>you pass your purse to him.</color> With a low chuckle, <color=#00FFFF>he vanishes into the woods</color> as quickly as he appeared.

Shuddering, you count what coin is left, hot blood trickling down your back.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Dollars</color>

stages.title: Robber
stages.text:
Money is precious, but your coins aren't worth dying for. There are some in your pockets that he didn't think of. You close your eyes and picture Canada as <color=#00FFFF>you pass your purse to him.</color> He gives a low chuckle and pulls back. You catch a glimpse of scruffy hair and an unshaven face scarred with razor marks before <color=#00FFFF>he vanishes into the woods</color> as quickly as he appeared.
With a shudder you count what's left as you hurry on your way. 

<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Dollars</color>

stages.title: Cliff
stages.text: The trees part in a broad clearing, giving you a good look at what's ahead. A large hill rises in front of you - no, more of a cliff, a rockface. Boulders and muck piled at the base give evidence of some kind of mudslide recently. The road curves around the massive hill, diverted by the slide, but <color=#00FFFF>you're sure it would be faster to go up over it.</color>

stages.title: Cliff
stages.text:
You haul yourself up onto the first of the boulders and climb towards the rockface. Then, groping for handholds and kicking at the dirt to carve footholds, you pull yourself up hand over hand, foot over foot. Pebbles bounce away from under your feet. Sweat soon beads on your forehead and slides down the sides of your face.
You haul yourself over the lip of the cliff, panting and sweaty. The view overlooks the miles of land stretching out below you, and you can vaguely trace the winding road you came by.

<color=#00FFFF>You continue on your way over the hill until you can join up with the trail again.</color>

stages.title: Cliff
stages.text:
You peer up the cliff, tracking the safest path with your eyes. It'll require some careful footwork.
You carefully climb the rockface. Pebbles bounce away from under your feet.
Something crackles under your fingers. You freeze. The rock gives way under your weight. <color=#00FFFF>You fall backwards with a cry and roll down the steep cliffside.</color> You slam into a boulder at the base.
With a moan, you push yourself into a sitting position, holding your head.
Sore and bruised, you stumble back to the path to <color=#00FFFF>take the long way.</color> 

<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Health</color>

stages.title: Cliff
stages.text: As you walk by, you get a full view of the cliff face, sheer and sharp-looking. You could've bashed your head in falling from that wall - but <color=#00FFFF>taking the long way</color> stings all the same.

stages.title: Beggar
stages.text: In a sparsely populated area, you come upon a ragged-looking, thin Black man seated at the edge of the road, an overturned hat in his hands, ugly boils on his face. When he turns his eyes to you, you see they are milky with cataracts. "Is tha' a traveler?" he croaks. <color=#00FFFF>"Please, can you spare anythin' for an old man in pain?"</color>

stages.title: Beggar
stages.text:
You feel bad for the poor man, as he hobbles toward you from the edge of the road. "I have a few coins," you offer.

"Anythin'," he says. "Anythin'."

<color=#00FFFF>You hand him 50 cents from your purse.</color>

"Bless you, traveler," he croaks, pressing his hands together as if in prayer. "Bless you."

<color=#FF0000>Lose 50 Cents</color> 

<color=#00FF00>Gain 1 Luck</color>

stages.title: Beggar
stages.text:
You feel bad for the poor man, as he hobbles toward you from the edge of the road. "I have a bit of food," you offer.

"Anythin'," he says. "Anythin'."

<color=#00FFFF>You hand him 2 loaves from your bag.</color>

"Bless you, traveler," he croaks, pressing his hands together as if in prayer. "Bless you."

<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Food</color> 

<color=#00FF00>Gain 1 Luck</color>

stages.title: Beggar
stages.text:
You feel bad for the poor man, as he hobbles toward you from the edge of the road. "I have a bit of medicine for those sores," you offer.

"Anythin'," he says. "Anythin'."
You hand him a bit of medication from your bag.

"Bless you, traveler," he rasps, pressing his hands together as if in prayer. "Bless you."

<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Medicine</color> 

<color=#00FF00>Gain 1 Luck</color>

stages.title: Beggar
stages.text:
You feel bad for the poor man, as he hobbles toward you from the edge of the road. "I - I can't give anything," you mumble. 'I'm sorry."

"Anythin'," he says. "Anythin'. Please."

"I'm sorry," you say again, pushing past him. "I can't. I can't."

<color=#00FFFF>You hurry down the road</color> with a new heaviness. He reminded you of the elderly back at your former plantation - just as uncared for as he.

stages.title: Beggar
stages.text:
You force yourself to look away. You need everything in your bag, which you grip tighter to yourself as you push by him.

"Please, traveler," he calls, as you pass by, but <color=#00FFFF>you're already hurrying out of his sight.</color>

stages.title: Mold
stages.text:
You notice an unpleasant smell eminating from your pack - musty and earthy. Wrinkling your nose, you pull it open. The odor washes over you, and you notice a loaf of your bread is covered in slimy, fuzzy-looking gray mold. Moisture probably leaked in at some point. <color=#00FFFF>The bread is unedible.</color> 

<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Food</color>

stages.title: Mouse
stages.text:
As you take a rest in the shade of a large oak, you reach into your pack for a drink. Your fingers brush a ragged edge. Looking closer, you see that the sack for one of your bags of oats has been gnawed through and <color=#00FFFF>nearly the whole bag is missing.</color> The tiny tooth-marks prove it: a mouse got into your bag at some point during the night.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Food</color>

stages.title: Bee Sting
stages.text: You decide to take a path that weaves through a field of knee-high grass brimming with flowers and fat bees dawdling between them. About halfway across, <color=#00FFFF>you feel a sharp, burning pain on your calf.</color> With a yelp, you slap a hand to the spot. Already, you can feel the welt forming, and your skin is bright red under your fingers.

stages.title: Bee Sting
stages.text:
Eyes watering, you pull your pack open and <color=#00FFFF>retrieve a small jar of ointment.</color> Using the cap, you scrape the stinger free of your wound, then rub the contents of the jar onto the sting. The gel is cool and soothes the burning welt. You heave a sigh of relief as the pain fades.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Medicine</color>

stages.title: Bee Sting
stages.text: Eyes watering, you look around the field, hoping to spare your precious medicine reserves. Flowers sway softly in the breeze amid the tall grasses. A bright cluster of purple blossoms low to the ground catches your eye: beebalm. You hobble over, awkwardly clutching your calf, and pinch off a stem to squeeze out the resin. Carefully, <color=#00FFFF>you pull out the stinger and rub this into the wound.</color> You heave a sigh of relief as the pain fades slightly.

stages.title: Hunter's Cache
stages.text: In the woods off the trail, obscured by bushes, you see an oak bin of the sort that hunters sometimes use to store supplies. <color=#00FFFF>There might be food in there.</color>

stages.title: Hunter's Cache
stages.text:
The box is mostly empty except for some dust, a hatchet, and, to your delight, <color=#00FFFF>some sort of dried meat sealed in a bag and a roll of bandages.</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain 2 Food</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain 1 Medicine</color>

stages.title: Hunter's Cache
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>The bin is empty</color> except for some dust and a few spiders that go scurrying away at your arrival. Disappointed, you head back to the trail.

stages.title: Hunter's Cache
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>You ignore the cache and keep walking.</color> The cache means hunters, and hunters mean danger. It's not worth it.

stages.title: Pawpaw Tree
stages.text: In a ravine down the side of the road, you see a broad-leafed tree laden with thig green fruits. You recognize these from home: pawpaws. <color=#00FFFF>Healthy and edible, but clambering up and down the ravine might take time.</color>

stages.title: Pawpaw Tree
stages.text:
You scramble down into the ravine, slipping and sliding a little, and approach the trees. The pawpaws are fat and ripe. <color=#00FFFF>You stuff several into your pack and then return to the road.</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain 2 Food</color>

stages.title: Pawpaw Tree
stages.text: You don't have time to forage. You continue along the road.

stages.title: Pawpaw Tree
stages.text: In a ravine down the side of the road, you see a broad-leafed tree laden with thig green fruits. You recognize these from home: pawpaws. Healthy and edible, but clambering up and down the ravine might take time.

stages.title: Pawpaw Tree
stages.text:
You scramble down into the ravine, slipping and sliding a little, and approach the trees. The pawpaws are fat and ripe. You stuff several into your pack and then return to the road.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 2 Food</color>

stages.title: Pawpaw Tree
stages.text: You don't have time to forage. You continue along the road.

stages.title: Hill
stages.text:
While climbing a tall hill, some gravel under your feet gives way. You slip and fall, <color=#00FFFF>bashing your knee against ragged stone.</color> Pain blooms in your leg, and you leave behind a smear of blood on the rock as you limp the rest of the way up the hill.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Health</color>

stages.title: Farm Work
stages.text: You come to a farm where a few workers are throwing heavy bags of grain onto a large cart, slick with sweat. One of them glances up as you approach, using his shirt to mop his brow. <color=#00FFFF>"Lend a hand for a coin or two, traveler?</color> You look like the burly sort."

stages.title: Farm Work
stages.text:
You agree and take up a few of the bags with the other farmhands, tossing them up onto the cart. Your muscles strain, but with an extra hand, the work goes faster. Once the cart is loaded, the man who stopped you slaps you on the back. "Thanks, friend," he says, and <color=#00FFFF>slips a few coins into your hand.</color> "Safe travels," 

<color=#00FF00>Gain 50 Cents</color>

stages.title: Farm Work
stages.text: You wave back, but shake your head. "Sorry, fellas, got places to be." The men make good-natured sounds of disappointment as you breeze by, but soon they and their labored grunts are out of sight behind you.

stages.title: Fog Bank
stages.text: In the valley between two hills lies a heavy bank of fog. As you descend, the thick white closes in, until <color=#00FFFF>you can barely see the trail ahead of you.</color> Trees loom suddenly out of the fog and then recede into blurred ghosts as quickly as they appeared. Chills sneak down your arms. <color=#00FFFF>It would be easy to get lost.</color>

stages.title: Fog Bank
stages.text: You slow to a crawl to focus on the obscured path ahead, dodging low branches that otherwise would have smacked you. Slight wind whispers around your ears, stirring the fog into whirling patterns that chase you like false ghosts. But <color=#00FFFF>your slow and steady progress leads you faithfully to the ridge opposite the valley without losing the path,</color> and you finally ascend out of the whiteness into the clear day again.

stages.title: Fog Bank
stages.text: You keep walking normally, squinting through the fog. You know how to use the ghostly trees to keep yourself moving forward, watching the stones that mark the path and dodging low-hanging branches. Soon, <color=#00FFFF>you ascend out of the whiteness into the clear day again.</color>

stages.title: Fog Bank
stages.text: You try and keep your pace, but the whirling patterns in the fog pull your eyes from the trail, thinking you see hostile faces within it. When you turn back, the trail has vanished through the bushes. Somehow, you've strayed. With rising panic, you dash through the woods, knocking aside branches - but <color=#00FFFF>you only manage to get more lost.</color> You wander for a long time until <color=#00FFFF>you finally stumble out of the whiteness into the clear day above again.</color>

stages.title: Farm Stand
stages.text: At the edge of a broad farm field, you see a small farm stand bristling with garden food. A young Black girl dozes at the counter, kicking her legs. She starts and looks up as you approach. "Hey!" she calls. <color=#00FFFF>"Buy some vegetables! Please!"</color> She bounces in place, waving.

stages.title: Farm Stand
stages.text: You nod to her, but <color=#00FFFF>you continue on your way.</color> "No! Wait! Buy some food!" she calls after you, running out into the road behind you and crossing her scrawny arms. "Please?" But you're already far down the road, and she glumly returns to the farm stand.

stages.title: Farm Stand
stages.text:
You stop by the stand, smiling at her eagerness. "What's the best of your crop, missus?"

She leans forward across the counter so eagerly she nearly falls over it. "The carrots are great this year, and the cabbage, and cucumber - and -" She rattles on, and <color=#00FFFF>you select a few veggies from the stand and hand over some coins.</color> She waves wildly at you as you walk away. "Thank you! Thank you!"

<color=#FF0000>Lose 25 Cents</color> 

<color=#00FF00>Gain 4 Food</color>

stages.title: Farm Stand
stages.text:
You stop at the stand, but <color=#00FFFF>the prices are too high and you shake your head.</color> "Sorry, miss. Not enough coin."

She blows a disappointed raspberry and crosses her scrawny arms. You smile apologetically and continue on your way.

stages.title: Ants
stages.text:
You feel a prickling at the back of your neck and swipe at it. A tiny black insect falls off. With horror, you realize it came from your bag. You pull it off your back with a shudder and open your bag. <color=#00FFFF>One of your containers is swarming with ants.</color> You snatch it out and toss it into the woods, spraying bugs as it bounces a few times across the ground.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Food</color>

stages.title: Investigators
stages.text:
A sharp blind corner in the road brings you face-to-face with two well-dressed men riding a pair of glossy horses. Compared to the normal travelers - poor whites, servants, farmers in tattered clothes - these two are out of place. From their long, clean coats, silk ties, and polished leather riding shoes, you can tell that they're wealthy. Probably landowners. Probably masters. You back up, but one of the men is already dismounting. 

One of the men removes his hat. "Greetings, friend," he says, in a way that tells you he is not your friend, nor perhaps anyone's. Your eyes fall on a pistol at his belt. <color=#00FFFF>"May I see your pass?"</color>

stages.title: Investigators
stages.text: You present them with your pass. Your master's handwriting is clear and dark. The man examines it with a slight sneer that fades to a frown. He holds it up to the light, examines the ink closely, then shakes his head. <color=#00FFFF>"You're free to go, traveler,"</color> he says, with a twinge of something that sounds like disappointment. He remounts his horse and the two canter on ahead of you, leaving you in the dust.

stages.title: Investigators
stages.text:
You know you have no pass. Your arms tremble as you stall, making a show of reaching into your bag and searching for the pass. Your brain whirls to form a plan. "Sorry, sirs, I must have lost it somewhere..."

Your hand finds a jar of pickled vegetables. With a sudden heave you throw it at the investigator, catching him in the temple. The other man shouts. You turn and <color=#00FFFF>flee into the woods,</color> crushing bushes, ducking between trees. Three shots ring out. You feel something bury itself in your arm and clap a hand over your mouth to keep from crying out.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Food</color>

<color=#FF0000>Lose 5 Health</color>

stages.title: The Plantation House
stages.text: You approach the great mansion looming over the plantation like a white vulture. Slaves hunch over the fields, gathering tobacco leaves and stuffing them into baskets, sweating under the sun. On the porch between two pillars sits <color=#00FFFF>your enslaver</color>, reading a newspaper and puffing on a long pipe beneath his crooked panama hat.

stages.title: The Plantation House
stages.text:
You remove your hat in a facade of respect. "Master? Sir?"
He looks up from his paper with languid blue eyes and raises his brows at you. You launch into a carefully prepared <color=#00FFFF>request for a pass</color> to visit family at a nearby plantation. Your sister just married, you claim, and it's only right to give her a good Christian congratulations...

After a moment of thought, he blows a puff of smoke into your face and nods. <color=#00FFFF>He writes you a pass and hands it to you.</color> "Well wishes," he grunts, then returns to his newspaper.

 <color=#00FF00>Gained a Travel Pass.</color>

stages.title: The Plantation House
stages.text:
You remove your hat in a facade of respect. "Master? Sir?"

He looks up from his paper with languid blue eyes and raises his brows at you.

You launch into a carefully prepared <color=#00FFFF>request for a pass</color> to visit family at a nearby plantation. Your sister just married, you claim, and it's only right to give her a good Christian congratulations...

But <color=#00FFFF>he shakes his head</color>. "It's harvest time," he says. "Back to work." He turns back to his paper with a definitive air.

If you press him, he might get suspicious. You decide not to risk it and <color=#00FFFF>head back towards the fields</color> with a mumbled apology.

stages.title: The Plantation House
stages.text: If you press him, he might get suspicious. You decide not to risk it and <color=#00FFFF>head back towards the fields</color> with a mumbled apology.

stages.title: Nearby Store
stages.text: Down the road from the plantation is the <color=#00FFFF>local general store</color>. You enter to see shelves bristling with wares, everything from pots to denim to fresh-milled flour,and even some tobacco from your own plantation. Behind the counter stands a hired-out slave who you tend to see managing the store while the store's owner is away.

stages.title: Nearby Store
stages.text:
You <color=#00FFFF>hand over the coins</color> and buy some food.

<color=#00FF00>Gained 10 Food.</color>

stages.title: Nearby Store
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>You don't have enough money</color> to afford food.

stages.title: Nearby Store
stages.text: Your bag newly weighted with food, you decide to <color=#00FFFF>head back to the plantation.</color>

stages.title: Friend's Cabin
stages.text:
The cabins sit in a long row. Two down is <color=#00FFFF>the residence of your childhood friend Mary Anne.</color> She's seated on the steps, twisting her apron in her hands. She doesn't look surprised to see you. She knows where you're going.
There are no words large enough for goodbye. You pull each other into a long, heavy hug. You feel her shoulders shaking, but when she steps back, she's resolute.
"Here," she says as <color=#00FFFF>she presses a coin into your hands.</color> "It'll do you more good than it'll do me, where - where you're going." She takes your hands. "Be careful. Please."
You hope it's a promise you can keep.

 <color=#00FF00>Gained 50 Cents.</color>

stages.title: Your Cabin
stages.text: Your cabin is a one-room, ramshackle little building, the ancient wood siding falling apart and the floorboards stained with years of water from the leaky ceiling. A few crooked candles wait on the wobbly table along with a few pots and bowls and a line of clothes hanging across the small, sooty fireplace. <color=#00FFFF>Your bed in the corner, with its tattered quilt, is unmade.</color> The room always smells faintly of damp earth and woodsmoke.

stages.title: Your Cabin
stages.text: You sleep like a stone and wake up well rested.

stages.title: Your Cabin
stages.text: You exit the cabin and head back to the plantation.

stages.title: General Store
stages.text: You enter a general store, pushing past a few locals who chatter in the entryway. The shelves are well-stocked: <color=#00FFFF>flour from the mill, teas, spices, canned preserves from the city, bottles, salt, farm tools, bags of seed.</color> The shop owner stands behind the counter, gaze prickling at the back of your neck as you move about the store.

stages.title: General Store
stages.text:
You wander the shelves and gather supplies. At the counter, you <color=#00FFFF>hand over your coins</color> and leave with a heavier pack.

 <color=#00FF00>Gained 10 Food.</color>

stages.title: General Store
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>You don't have enough money</color> to afford food.

stages.title: General Store
stages.text: After shopping, you decide to <color=#00FFFF>head back into town.</color>

stages.title: Doctor's Office
stages.text: You enter the doctor's office. Patterned green wallpaper encircles a small room containing a tall oaken cabinet containing vials and jars of medicine, a large plush exam chair in the center of the room, and a wooden desk at which an old man who must be the doctor is seated. He looks up from a pile of paperwork and peers at you through his glasses. His voice is raspy. "Ah, a patient. <color=#00FFFF>Come in."</color>

stages.title: Doctor's Office
stages.text:
You hand over the coins. The doctor weighs you, compresses your tongue to peer inside your mouth, then motions you to the plush examination chair. Pulling up a stool and adjusting his glasses, he asks, "Now. What can I help you with today?"

 <color=#00FF00>Gained Health.</color>

stages.title: Doctor's Office
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>You don't have enough money</color> to afford help.

stages.title: Doctor's Office
stages.text: You <color=#00FFFF>head back into town.</color>

stages.title: Troy Inn
stages.text: You enter a local inn run by a free person. The entry room is cozy, occupied by a few plush chairs, thick rug, and a fireplace over which a painting of wild horses hangs. Laughter and the clink of silverware drifts in from the inn restaurant in the next room over. A rickety, winding set of stairs leads to the second floor and bedrooms. Tending the front desk is a young Black woman who looks up and smiles politely as you enter and <color=#00FFFF>ask about a room.</color>

stages.title: Troy Inn
stages.text:
You hand over the coins for your stay and head up the spiral staircase, which creaks under your weight. The bedroom is small, dominated by a sizable bed against one wall, a polished wooden dressing table with a mirror on another, and a window hung with heavy velvet drapes looking out over the street. You pull the drapes shut and collapse into the soft bed, knowing <color=#00FFFF>you'll sleep well tonight.</color>

 <color=#00FF00>Remove Exhaustion.</color>

stages.title: Troy Inn
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>You don't have enough money</color> to afford to stay.

stages.title: Troy Inn
stages.text: You head <color=#00FFFF>back into town.</color>

stages.title: Lumberyard
stages.text: From all the way across town, you can hear workers calling to each other from the <color=#00FFFF>large lumberyard</color> on the banks of the nearby river. Sweating men haul massive trees to steam barges waiting at the shore. Others wave teams of horses hauling new lumber shipments from the forest into the yard. Smoke billows from the chimneystack of the main building. A few of the workers, you notice, are Black men, who mingle easily with the whites. Perhaps you can pretend to be a hired out slave to <color=#00FFFF>earn some money.</color>

stages.title: Lumberyard
stages.text:
You locate the foreman and ask for work, who assigns you to a barge-loading team without further question - extra hands are not refused. Yours quickly become studded with splinters, and sweat streaks your brow. But the pay is good, and after working for a few hours, <color=#00FFFF>the foreman hands you some money</color> for your labors.

 <color=#00FF00>Gain 25 cents.</color>

stages.title: Lumberyard
stages.text: You head <color=#00FFFF>back into town.</color>

stages.title: Newspaper Stand
stages.text:
The boy at the newspaper stand looks at you. His cap is on sideways. "Hey Dingaling! The paper ain't out yet! Ha ha! What a wacky conundrum! Come back later once we've made the paper and added it to this news stand. Wink!"
You're not sure why he said "wink" out loud, but you assume it's just some cheeky new phrase. <color=#00FFFF>Better get going.</color>

stages.title: Butcher Shop
stages.text: Beneath a sign shaped like a fat pig is the town butcher shop. You go inside, where a tall, broad-shouldered woman in a stained apron sharpens a knife behind the counter. An array of fresh meat glistens inside the display case, from marbled beef to thick sausage to heavy slabs of pork. On the wall behind the counter hangs full chickens hung by their feet from hooks alongside other heavy cuts. The woman squints at you, wiping her hands on her apron. "I know that look," she says. <color=#00FFFF>"You're hoping for work, that right?"</color>

stages.title: Butcher Shop
stages.text:
"Yes, missus," you say, and the woman cracks a grin. She lends you an apron and puts you to work cleaning the counters, then mopping the cutting room in back. Great sides of beef hang from the ceiling and sweat juices slowly into drains in the floor. The whole place has the tangy iron scent of blood hanging in the air. When you're done mopping, <color=#00FFFF>she hands you a few coins and a small pack of cured meat</color> as thanks.

<color=#00FF00>Gain 25 Cents</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain 4 Food</color>

stages.title: Butcher Shop
stages.text: You shake your head. "No, missus, I was just looking." You step back out of the shop and <color=#00FFFF>into town again.</color>

stages.title: Stable
stages.text: The small downtown includes a <color=#00FFFF>bustling stable</color> full of bored horses and stablehands grooming and feeding them. Every so often a new visitor drops their horse with the attendants and leaves to enjoy the town. Off to the side of the livery is a small office, where the patrons stop to drop off money. If you speak with whoever is in there, <color=#00FFFF>you might be able to make a quick coin as a stablehand.</color>

stages.title: Stable
stages.text:
In the office, a squat little man with a big hat directs you to muck out a few of the empty stalls and prepare it for the next guest. You take a shovel and head into the barn.Horses line the barn, all twitching tails, shuffling hooves and nervous, rolling eyes. You make your way to an empty stall and find it full of crushed hay and horse apples. Wrinkling your nose, <color=#00FFFF>you get to work.</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain 25 Cents</color>

stages.title: Stable
stages.text: You can smell the horses from here. Wrinkling your nose, you turn away from the livery and <color=#00FFFF>head back into town.</color>

stages.title: Saloon Inn
stages.text: The local boarding house appears to be a joint saloon and inn. As soon as you step inside, the smell of cigar smoke stings your nostrils, reminding you unpleasantly of the stink that always followed your master around. The interior is dimly lit, comprising of a restaurant and bar. The clink of glasses and murmur of low conversation fill the air. Patrons roll dice and lay down cards and money. You pick your way over to the bar to <color=#00FFFF>inquire about a room for the night,</color> trying to ignore the narrow gazes a few customers cast your way.

stages.title: Saloon Inn
stages.text:
The stairs leading up to the overnight rooms are lined with "Wanted" posters, advertisements for a local circus, and town notices. Your eyes track nervously over the posters, but you do not see your name or face, and you make it to your room with a sign of relief. A small bed nestles beside a rickety bedstand and a grimy window. You drop your bag on the floor and <color=#00FFFF>collapse into the bed</color>, exhausted.

 <color=#00FF00>Remove Exhaustion.</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain 3 Health</color>

stages.title: Saloon Inn
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>You don't have enough money</color> to afford to stay.

stages.title: Saloon Inn
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>head back into town,</color> waving smoke out of your face.

stages.title: Saloon Restaurant
stages.text: The main restaurant of the saloon is heavy with smoke and the scent of cooking meat wafting from the kitchen. Weaving between tables full of gamblers hunched over their cards and nursing their whiskeys, you head to the bar. The bartender, a young man in a sharp vest, finishes pouring a glass of alcohol for a scruffy man at the counter, then looks to you in askance. "What can I do for you? Bourbon? Scotch? <color=#00FFFF>Work?</color>"

stages.title: Saloon Restaurant
stages.text:
"Work," you say. Through the kitchen door, you can see a stack of unwashed plates piled by the sink. "It looks as though you could use it."

He follows your gaze and nods a little sheepishly. "The washerboy didn't show up today. Come along then."

You take up a position in the kitchen washing plates and glasses until your hands are wrinkled. Conversation swells pleasantly in the bar outside, and you find yourself humming in content as you work. After <color=#00FFFF>a few hours</color>, the next washer comes in to take your place, and the bartender <color=#00FFFF>hands you a quarter</color> and thanks you.

stages.title: Saloon Restaurant
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>You head back into town.</color>

stages.title: Church
stages.text:
The church shocks you with its size. Two great steeples of whitewashed stone rise on either side of the entrance, dwarfing the surrounding buildings. You gingerly push the door open and step inside, where the light now falls over rows and rows of pews in colorful patterns from the stained glass window.

Near the alter, a Black priest sits with his head bowed in prayer before a gilded gold cross. He looks up as you enter. "Greetings," he says, in a low, soothing voice. <color=#00FFFF>"Do you seek freedom?"</color>

stages.title: Church
stages.text:
You nod. "I seek freedom, Father."

"I can help you," he says. "You will be asked for proof. <color=#00FFFF>For ten dollars</color> and <color=#00FFFF>a day of your time,</color> I can provide it."

The thought of free papers raises your pulse, but the price tag halts you. "That's expensive, Father."

As you fumble for your purse, a sad look crosses his face. "So is hiding my people, child. Can you pay?"

stages.title: Church
stages.text: "No, Father. I must go." You incline your head respectfully to him and <color=#00FFFF>exit</color> the way you came. The great doors boom shut behind you.

stages.title: Church
stages.text:
A wave of relief washes over you as you find the money in your purse. Closing your eyes, you think of the fir forests and free cities of Canada, a boat's ride across the open water and to freedom. Ten dollars is a small price in exchange. You hand the money to the priest, who takes it with a slight bow. "By tomorrow, you will have your freedom papers."

In the meantime, he leads you to the church cellar, where other runaways sleep on mats or wash themselves in a dirty tub of water. You help him clean their blankets, tend their wounds, and fetch fresh water. In the morning, <color=#00FFFF>he gives you the forged papers as promised</color> and bids you safe travels.

<color=#00FF00>Gain Free Papers</color>

stages.title: Church
stages.text:
"No, Father. I - <color=#00FFFF>I don't have the money</color>." You clutch your purse. "Is there no other way...?"

The priest shakes his head. "I'm sorry, child. But I can lodge you. Would you like to stay and sleep?"

stages.title: Church
stages.text: He leads you to the church cellar, where other runaways sleep on mats. You all stare at each other in the silent darkness, listening to footsteps pass back and forth overhead. You wonder about the mats and how many runaways they've housed. In the morning, <color=#00FFFF>you leave well-rested,</color> and the priest bids you safe travels.

stages.title: Wapakoneta Inn
stages.text: The walls of the Wapakoneta Inn are a deep burgundy, the red plush chairs made of a matching dark wood and the trim a bright cream color. A painting of the Ohio countryside hangs above a large brick fireplace. The front desk is empty when you arrive, but you ring the bell and a young woman with thick glasses fussing over a stack of papers emerges from the back. She stops when she sees you. Her mouth flattens into a hard line. <color=#00FFFF>"Negroes stay in the attic,"</color> she says curtly.

stages.title: Wapakoneta Inn
stages.text:
You grit your teeth and hand over the money. She pinches it between two fingers as if it's tainted, then passes you a key in the same manner. You plod up the stairs, past the much nicer inn rooms, to the small attic. You sneeze on the dust as soon as you enter and find a room lit by only a single lamp and lacking a window. In the corner is a bare twin mattress and a stack of sheets. Still, it beats sleeping on the side of the road, and you make the bed quickly before your drowsiness gets the better of you. <color=#00FFFF>Sleep at last.</color> 

<color=#00FF00>Remove Exhaustion.</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain 3 Health</color>

stages.title: Wapakoneta Inn
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>You don't have enough money</color> to afford to stay.

stages.title: Wapakoneta Inn
stages.text: You <color=#00FFFF>head back into town,</color> bristling.

stages.title: Bowling Green Inn
stages.text: The town inn is a large, squat, rectangular building on the edge of town with a broad oak door. The brickwork is cracked and crumbling in a few places, and the interior is spare, a hard stone floor and a wilted plant in one of the windows. Across from the front desk is a single table with three chairs and a small fireplace, above which hangs a taxidermied deer head. The desk manager, an elderly Black man, is dozing but jolts awake when the door jingles open. "So sorry, so sorry," he stammers, shuffling to get his desk in order. "One room?"

stages.title: Bowling Green Inn
stages.text:
You pay and he hands over a key. Your room has its basic amenities and not much more: a bed with its sheets folded neatly at the foot, a mirror, and a dresser. A small, framed illustration hangs next to the mirror - it looks like a child's drawing of a horse more than anything. You kick off your shoes and immediately pull them back on; the bare stone floor is cold. Setting your bag on the dresser, you set about fixing the sheets so that you can finally rest.

 <color=#00FF00>Remove Exhaustion.</color>

<color=#00FF00>Gain 3 Health</color>

stages.title: Bowling Green Inn
stages.text: <color=#00FFFF>You don't have enough money</color> to afford to stay.

stages.title: Bowling Green Inn
stages.text: You shake your head and <color=#00FFFF>turn back to town.</color>

stages.title: Entering Wapakoneta
stages.text: The tiny farmhouses and shanties dotting the land gradually begin to cluster into small residential areas. Travel carriages clip-clop by you. Soon, you can see the church spires of Wapakoneta ahead, nestled between great rolling farm fields. A bridge over the Auglaize River leads you onto the wide main street, first past houses and then shops, restaurants, and a <color=#00FFFF>doctor's office</color>. The air reeks of the horses that pull carts and carriages to and from <color=#00FFFF>a livery at the road's end,</color>, <color=#00FFFF>a newspaper boy</color>waves his papers from the middle of the street, and throaty laughter drifts from the open windows of <color=#00FFFF>a saloon inn</color> across the way. After the silence of the woods, the noise is a shock. You stand there for a moment just to take it in.

stages.title: Entering Troy
stages.text: Pausing at the top of one of the rolling hills that dot the landscape, you see from afar the town of Troy clustered around the Great Miami River that lays like a thick snake through the center. You pick your way down to the main road, amazed at the number of buildings. The steeples of several churches jut into the sky, the post office is bustling with locals, and wooden clattering from the <color=#00FFFF>lumber yard</color> drifts down. People talk and laugh loudly, shoving past you on the street as if you weren't even there. Down the road you can see a <color=#00FFFF>a small in</color>, probably cheap, the local <color=#00FFFF>general store</color>, and at least two <color=#00FFFF>doctor's offices</color>.

stages.title: Entering Bowling Green
stages.text: It feels generous to call the main street of Bowling Green a downtown. A few horses pull carriages along the road, kicking up dust that sends the few passerby into coughing fits. The post office has a line of only a few people clutching packages. A farmer holding a fresh cut of meat leaves the <color=#00FFFF>butcher shop</color> across the street; an old woman argues with a shopkeep in the front door of the <color=#00FFFF>general store</color>. Further off, muffled <color=#00FFFF>church</color> organ music swells. A stumpy brick building at the end of the street looks to be a <color=#00FFFF>local inn</color>. None of the sleepy-looking people walking by give you a second glance.

stages.title: Entering Detroit
stages.text: Detroit sprawls like a lumpy blanket across the land. Buildings taller than any you've seen press their ceilings against the sky, boasting stonework facades finer than that of the fanciest churches back home. Smog belches from the smokestacks of boats and factories alike along the banks of the Detroit River. Horse-drawn carriages speed by with barely a thought, leaving you to dodge the spray of dirt and pounding hooves. Shopkeepers shout their wares from beneath fabric awnings along the wide boulevards; pedestrians curse at the reckless carriages and yell to one another.You've never seen so many people in one place, and you find yourself slack-jawed as the crowds jostle and push you. You shake yourself. Somehow, in this massive city, <color=#00FFFF>you must find your way to the ferry.</color>

stages.title: Busy Street
stages.text:
You shove and elbow your way through the dense throngs of people until your way is blocked by a <color=#00FFFF>bustling road.</color> Seemingly without rhyme or reason, carriages fly back and forth, only by miracle not colliding, their drivers spewing an array of colorful curses at the other coachmen. Bicycles weave in and out of the traffic. Most pedestrians don't even bother trying to cross here, but it's the most direct way. 

To cross, <color=#00FFFF>you'll somehow have to ford the seething river of coaches</color> to reach the opposite sidewalk.

stages.title: Busy Street
stages.text: You plunge into the flow of carriages. "Watch it!" someone shouts, and a pair of chestnut mares speed by on your left. You run, undaunted, ducking through the traffic. A carriage nearly clips you to the left; a bicycle veers sideways to dodge you. Stumbling and panting and waving dust away, <color=#00FFFF>you make it to the other side.</color>

stages.title: Busy Street
stages.text:
You plunge into the flow of carriages. "Watch it!" someone shouts, and a pair of chestnut mares gallop by on your left. You leap aside, only to <color=#00FFFF>collide</color> with a speeding bicyclist, sending you both to the ground.
