You look up to see a large mare bearing down on you; the coachman shouts and yanks the horse to the side, hitting a cart headed in the opposite direction. Dust flies as the two clash into each other, trampling the fallen bicycle. Through the dust comes angry shouting; someone tries to grab you by the scruff of your neck. You <color=#00FFFF>scurry away before they can snatch you</color> and dash into an alley on the far side of the road. 

<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Health</color>

stages.title: Busy Street
stages.text: It's not worth risking your neck in that throng. Following the crowd, you walk down the street until the carriages thin out enough to <color=#00FFFF>cross to the other side.</color>

stages.title: Muggers
stages.text: You traverse through alleyways, trying to make your way to the docks. A few ragged bums snooze behind mounds of trash. You don't notice you're being followed until two men step out in front of you. <color=#00FFFF>You're trapped.</color> "How 'bout some coin, stranger?" a raspy voice behind you says, his breath stinking of stale cigarette.

stages.title: Muggers
stages.text: You grab the man behind you and throw him to the ground. The other two shout and charge at you, but you slip between them and shove them into the first man as he tries to rise, sending them all into a cussing, furious heap. The alleyway ahead of you now clear, <color=#00FFFF>you escape to the nearest busy street</color> and lose yourself in the crowd.

stages.title: Muggers
stages.text:
You grab the man behind you, but he kicks you in the back of the knee and you stumble over. His foot catches the side of your face, sending you sprawling on your back. A trail of blood trickles down your chin. "Search 'em, boys," the man with the cigarette says, and rough hands grab your bag and thrust themselves into your pockets, <color=#00FFFF>taking your coins.</color>

The crunch of a footstep echoes from beyond the alley. The muggers pause.

"Let's get outta here," one of the others growls, throwing your bag next to you on the ground. The three vanish into the stinking alley.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Dollar</color>

<color=#FF0000>Lose 4 Health</color>

stages.title: Muggers
stages.text:
You throw your hands in the air. "I - I don't have much," you plead in a quavering voice.

The first man snorts. "We'll see, sport. Search 'em, boys."

Rough hands grab your bag and thrust themselves into your pockets, <color=#00FFFF>taking your coins.</color>

The crunch of a footstep echoes from beyond the alley. The muggers pause.

"Let's get outta here," one of the others growls, throwing your bag next to you on the ground. The three vanish into the stinking alley.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Dollar</color>

stages.title: Muggers
stages.text:
You throw your hands in the air. "I - I don't have much," you plead in a quavering voice.

The first man snorts. "We'll see, sport. Search 'em, boys."

Rough hands grab your bag and thrust themselves into your pockets, <color=#00FFFF>but they don't find any money.</color>

"This hayseed's dry," one of the men growls. "Ain't got dough." He shoves you, and you stumble to the ground. He gives you a halfhearted kick and spits. "Not worth that carcass." The three of them <color=#00FFFF>vanish back into the alley,</color> leaving you clutching your bag as bruises form on your side where his boot hit.#FF0000>Lose 1 Health</color>

stages.title: Lost in the City
stages.text: Even with the gridlike street design, <color=#00FFFF>the dizzying whirl of people and carriages quickly leave you disoriented.</color> When you stop to look at signs, passerby bump into you and grumble about slowpokes.

stages.title: Lost in the City
stages.text: You recognize the tip of a far-off smokestack which you saw from the hills coming in. You recall that it's connected to the mill beside the river. Keeping it in your sight, you weave along the streets and <color=#00FFFF>make your way towards the water.</color>

stages.title: Lost in the City
stages.text: You keep walking, glancing around at the surrounding buildings for familiar landmarks. It all looks alien until you turn onto a sidestreet and realize you walked past that steeple a half hour earlier. With a rising sense of panic you pick another street that might lead to the waterfront, but wind up beside a pastry shop you know you saw before. <color=#00FFFF>You're well and truly lost.</color>

stages.title: Pickpocket
stages.text:
You don't feel the hand in your pocket until it's nicked a few coins. You spin around, looking for the culprit, but whoever it was has already vanished into the crowd. 

<color=#FF0000>Lose 15 Cents</color>

stages.title: Wanted Poster
stages.text:
You pause at a public bulletin with a map on it to check your direction. A stout, blonde-haired woman seated on a bench nearby glances at you with a frown, then peers at the bulletin. She stands. "Say. That face look mighty similar, don't it?"

You follow her gaze and your stomach curdles in on itself. There, in careful artist's hand, is a rendition of your face. Below is written: "$100 REWARD. RUNAWAY NEGRO. RETURN TO THE UNDERSIGNED." Below is the seal and name of your master along with the address of your plantation.

stages.title: Wanted Poster
stages.text:
"No missus," you say, lying easily. "I been working here for the sawmill since I was a kid."

The woman's frown deepens. She squints between you and the poster. "Mighty similar," she repeats.

"We ain't all alike, you know," you reply, careful to keep your voice steady. She considers you for a moment longer, then grunts in disappointment. "Could use that hundred," she mutters to herself as she ambles back to the bench. You hurry down the street before she can change her mind.

stages.title: Wanted Poster
stages.text:
"N-no missus," you say, voice shaking."

The woman's frown deepens. She squints between you and the poster. "Mighty similar," she repeats. You try to squeak something in denial, but seizes your arm. "Can sure use that hundred."

You try to pull free, but someone grabs your other arm. "I saw the poster first," a man's voice hisses. His fingernails dig into your skin. 

"No, this Negro's mine!" The woman's face contorts and she yanks you hard towards herself. Passerby stop to stare. With a sudden pull that twists your leg in an unnatural arc, you're able to <color=#00FFFF>jolt yourself free</color> and <color=#00FFFF>flee down the street</color> until their shouts fade behind you.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Health</color>

stages.title: Wanted Poster
stages.text:
You turn and run. The woman shouts in surprise, then hollers, "Catch that Negro! It's mine, it's mine!"

Passerby turn, but you're already flying past them. You turn down alleyways and race down streets, winding through Detroit until <color=#00FFFF>you're safely away</color> and certain you weren't followed.

stages.title: Wanted Poster
stages.text:
You turn and run. The woman shouts in surprise, then hollers, "Catch that Negro! It's mine, it's mine!"

Passerby turn. Someone seizes your arm, throwing you off-balance. You crash into the street. Pain shoots down your arm as you awkwardly catch yourself on your elbow. But you manage to pull yourself up and fly across the street. You turn down alleyways and race down avenues, winding through Detroit until <color=#00FFFF>you're safely away</color> and certain you weren't followed.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Health</color>

stages.title: Stalker
stages.text: As you make your way down a broad, bustling boulevard, you notice that <color=#00FFFF>the same young man has been trailing you for some time.</color> You turn and walk in a circle around the block; he weaves deftly in and out of the crowd behind you, hanging back just enough to be plausibly deniable - but now you're certain he's after you. What he wants, you're not sure, but it can't be anything good.

stages.title: Stalker
stages.text: You quicken your pace and weave deftly through the foot traffic. When you glance behind you, the young man is struggling to keep up while keeping his pursuit subtle. When the crowd cloaks you, you turn abruptly into a narrow alley and duck behind a trash bin. You see him speed past the alley with frustration written into the furrow of his brow. <color=#00FFFF>He's lost you.</color>

stages.title: Stalker
stages.text:
You quicken your pace as much as you can without breaking into a run and shove through the foot traffic, but he does too, threatening to outstrip you. His mouth is set in a hard, determined line. In a moment of panic you leap forward and run full-tilt across the street. Your foot catches on a loose cobblestone, twisting your ankle. You stagger the rest of the way and throw yourself into an alley, ankle throbbing. But <color=#00FFFF>you seem to have shaken him.</color>

<color=#FF0000>Lose 1 Health</color>

stages.title: Police
stages.text: A pair of heavily moustachioed police in uniform walk towards you through the crowd. You keep your eyes carefully fixed on the ground. At first it seems they'll pass you by, but then you hear the man on the left mutter something to the other, and they pause. "You there," the shorter of the two says, puffing out his chest. <color=#00FFFF>"Let's see some identification."</color>

stages.title: Police
stages.text:
With a slightly shaky hand, you root around in your bag and show the papers to the officers. The first takes it with a scowl and examines it carefully. You hold your breath as his eyes comb each line for signs of forgery.

But the priest kept his word, and the forged papers pass his inspection. He hands them back to you with a sigh. "Protocol," he says. "Checking all the Negroes around these parts."

<color=#00FFFF>You head back into the crowd</color> once the policemen walk away, glancing nervously around for more uniforms as you go.

stages.title: Police
stages.text:
Your stomach drops. <color=#00FFFF>You know you have no papers.</color> "S-sorry, sirs," you say."Musta left them at home."

The second policeman smiles patiently. "You won't mind, then, if we accompany you to retrieve them?"

Your brain spins, looking for an out. "No, no, I - I'm in a hurry - sorry -"

Before the police can respond, you turn and take off running. One blows his whistle with a shrill cry. Hands grab your bag, but as you yank it free, it pops open. Pills and bandages spill across the street. After twisting and turning through alleys, ducking into shops, and hiding behind balconies, you take inventory. 

<color=#FF0000>Lose 4 Medicine</color>

stages.title: Sewer Fumes
stages.text:
The cloud of white drifting out of a grate in the sidewalk appears to be nothing more than steam until you step over it. Your eyes water and burn, and you double over with raspy coughs. A sickly part-chlorine, part-sulfur scent stings your nostrils. You stumble out of the smoke and lean against a nearby wall to hack it out of your lungs, but the <color=#00FFFF>lingering pain</color> in your throat remains.

<color=#FF0000>Lose 2 Health</color>

stages.title: Boat Ending
stages.text:
You emerge from the city onto the broad docks of the Detroit River. The banks are lined with smokestacks, low stone warehouses, cheap restaurants, and riverside stores offering kitschy souveniers. Workers haul barrels or direct carriages to great barges awaiting cargo. A few docks down, <color=#00FFFF>the Detroit-Windsor Ferry is already boarding.</color> Your footsteps quicken to nearly a run as you dry your suddenly clammy palms on your jacket. You stop at the ticket booth, where an idle man with a crooked tie looks up from behind a newspaper. "One ticket, please," you say breathlessly.

<color=#00FFFF>"That'll be three dollars,"</color> he says.

stages.title: Boat Ending
stages.text: You root around in your purse and almost throw the money into his hand. You reach for the ticket. "Ah ah," he says, holding it back. "One more thing. <color=#00FFFF>Negroes need free papers to board this ferry."</color>

stages.title: Boat Ending
stages.text:
You pull out your money, fingers quivering. <color=#00FFFF>You don't have enough.</color> "This - this is all I have," you whisper. "Please, I need a ticket..."

The man shrugs, unmoved. "Rate's three dollars. No can do." He glances behind you and raises his eyebrows. You don't like the smirk that teases his lips. "Maybe these fellas can help."

A hand lands on each of your shoulders, tight and heavy. You cry out, but before you can pull away, your arms are yanked behind your back and cold metal clicks into place around your wrists. "Damn," a low voice chuckles. "This one almost got away."

You kick and thrash, but whoever holds you is strong. You turn your head enough to recognize one of your master's slave drivers holding you in cuffs. He's flanked on both sides by three policemen. The fight drains out of you, and you press your forehead against the ticket booth wiht a sob. The man gives you a sardonic, mirthless smile. <color=#00FFFF>"End of the road."</color>

stages.title: Boat Ending
stages.text:
You dig your crumpled forgeries out and pass them over along with your money. The man pulls out a magnifying glass and looks them over, tracing slowly over every line. Beyond the booth, the ferry blows its horn, preparing for departure. Finally the man sits back and nods.

You release a breath you hadn't realized you were holding. Your hands tremble as you take both the papers and the ticket from him.

The SS United awaits, and beyond it, the slaveless lands of Canada. Papers and ticket clutched to your chest, <color=#00FFFF>you board the ferry to freedom.</color>

stages.title: Boat Ending
stages.text:
Your voice sticks in your throat as a lump forms there. "...All Negroes?" you hear yourself whisper.

The man nods impatiently. "Yes, all. Hand 'em over."

You lick your dry lips. "I - I forgot them..."

He rolls his eyes. "Well, go get them, then." He glances behind you and raises his eyebrows. You don't like the smirk that teases his lips. "Or maybe these fellas can help."

A hand lands on each of your shoulders, tight and heavy. You cry out, but before you can pull away, your arms are yanked behind your back and cold metal clicks into place around your wrists. "Damn," a low voice chuckles. "This one almost got away."

You kick and thrash, but whoever holds you is strong. You turn your head enough to recognize one of your master's slave drivers holding you in cuffs. He's flanked on both sides by three policemen. The fight drains out of you, and you press your forehead against the ticket booth wiht a sob. The man gives you a sardonic, mirthless smile. <color=#00FFFF>"End of the road."</color>

stages.title: Trail Ending
stages.text: Your legs burn. It feels as though you carry the entire world in your bag, dragging your body down with its gravity. One more step, just one more. Now another, and another. And then you can take no more steps. Exhausted and weak, <color=#00FFFF>you sink to the ground in the middle of the road.</color> The sky seems to spin lazily above you. You close your eyes and try to picture Canada, its great pines and free peoples tilling the rich, cold soil, Black people like you, in homes and bodies they themselves own. But the image wavers and fades in your mind's eye <color=#00FFFF>until all you see is blackness.</color>

stages.title: City Ending
stages.text: The tall stone buildings that seemed so impressive when you entered now loom over you like thousand-eyed crows. Through the haze of your exhaustion, the sounds of conversation and the clatter of horse-hooves and wheels distort and echo in your head. Your legs burn, and your heavy bag sags off your worn, tired frame. You lean against the side of a steeple-like tower to catch your breath and look up into the sky. The tower's tip seems to sway against the smoggy sky. Dizzy, <color=#00FFFF>you sink down the wall to the cold, grimy sidewalk.</color> You close your eyes and try to picture Canada, its great pines and free peoples tilling the rich, cold soil, Black people like you, in homes and bodies they themselves own. But the image wavers and fades in your mind's eye <color=#00FFFF>until all you see is blackness.</color>
